official-title.#text:
To prohibit certain flights from landing in the United States and to prohibit the issuance of
			 certain visas to protect the United States from the Ebola virus disease,
			 and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committees on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Contain Ebola and Stop the Epidemic Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Contain Ebola and Stop the Epidemic Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prohibit from landing in the
			 United States any aircraft that—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of
			 the Federal Aviation Administration

text.#text: Beginning on the date that is 2 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the
is being used to provide scheduled passenger transportation for compensation; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for Disease Control and
			 Prevention

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Contain Ebola and Stop the Epidemic Act of 2014/s:4

text.#text:
departed with passengers whose air travel originated, or included a stop, in a foreign country in
			 which there is an epidemic with respect to the Ebola virus disease as
			 determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for Disease
			 Control and Prevention

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Contain Ebola and Stop the Epidemic Act of 2014/s:4

text.#text:
Beginning on the date that is 2 days after the date of enactment of this Act, no consular officer
			 (as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) may issue an immigrant or nonimmigrant visa to any
			 alien whose travel itinerary originates in, or includes transit through, a
			 foreign country in which there is an epidemic with respect to the Ebola
			 virus disease as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 101(a)(9) of the Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall make available to the public a list
			 of the foreign countries in which, as determined by the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director of the Centers for
			 Disease Control and Prevention

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, there is
			 an epidemic with respect to the Ebola virus disease.

text.#text: Not later than 2 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall maintain the list required under subsection (a) on an ongoing basis, removing
			 countries from the list and adding countries to the list as appropriate.
